BYTEDANCE.name: ByteDance
BYTEDANCE.tagline: Global technology company operating content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies
BYTEDANCE.overview: ByteDance Ltd. is a Chinese multinational technology company founded in 2012 by Zhang Yiming. The company operates a range of content platforms including TikTok (known as Douyin in China), Toutiao (news aggregator), Lark (enterprise software), and gaming divisions. ByteDance became the world's #1 social media company by revenue in Q1 2025, surpassing Meta with over $43 billion in quarterly revenue. The company's 2024 annual revenue reached $155 billion, with 75% coming from China. TikTok has 170 million US users and generates approximately $27 billion in international revenue. Despite regulatory challenges, ByteDance maintains a $330 billion valuation and continues aggressive expansion into AI, gaming, and enterprise software.

BREX.name: Brex
BREX.tagline: Reimagining corporate spend management with integrated cards, expense tracking, and travel
BREX.overview: Brex is a corporate spend management platform founded in 2017 by Henrique Dubugras and Pedro Franceschi, two Brazilian entrepreneurs who previously founded Pagar.me (Brazil's Stripe). Brex provides corporate cards, expense management, and financial services for startups and enterprises. The company reached $700M ARR in August 2025, up 50% YoY. Customers include DoorDash, Coinbase, Robinhood, and Roblox. In 2024, Pedro became sole CEO while Henrique moved to Chairman as the company targets a 2025 IPO.

BLOCKCHAINCOM.name: Blockchain.com
BLOCKCHAINCOM.tagline: Empowering individuals to access, hold, and transact cryptocurrency with ease
BLOCKCHAINCOM.overview: Blockchain.com is a cryptocurrency financial services company founded in 2011 by Peter Smith and Nicolas Cary. The company provides a cryptocurrency wallet, exchange, explorer, and institutional services. Blockchain.com reached a peak valuation of $14B in March 2022 after a $300M Series D. In February 2024, the company raised $110M in Series E strategic financing led by Kingsway Capital. The platform has over 90 million wallets created and serves users in 200+ countries. CEO Peter Smith aims to expand trading platforms and institutional services globally.

BOLT.overview: Bolt.new is an AI-powered browser-based web development platform by StackBlitz, founded by Eric Simons and Albert Pai. BACK-MARKET.name: Back Market
BACK-MARKET.tagline: The world's leading marketplace for refurbished electronics, connecting professional refurbishers with environmentally-conscious consumers
BACK-MARKET.overview: Back Market is the world's leading marketplace dedicated exclusively to refurbished electronic devices. Founded in 2014 in Paris, the platform connects over 17 million buyers with 2,700 vetted professional refurbishers across 18 markets. Back Market has raised over $1 billion and reached a $5.7 billion valuation in 2022. The company forecasts record €3 billion GMV in 2025, with the United States becoming its second-largest market. Back Market partners with carriers like Verizon's Visible and Bouygues Telecom to offer bundled wireless plans, making refurbished devices more accessible while promoting sustainable consumption and reducing electronic waste.

BACKBASE.name: Backbase
BACKBASE.tagline: The AI-powered engagement banking platform helping financial institutions accelerate digital transformation and compete in a digital-first world
BACKBASE.overview: Backbase is the leading AI-powered engagement banking platform serving over 150 financial institutions globally. Founded in 2003 in Amsterdam by Jouk Pleiter and Gerbert Kaandorp, the company provides an orchestration and intelligence layer that unifies data and manages customer interactions on top of legacy core banking systems. Backbase's platform enables banks and credit unions to deliver personalized digital experiences across retail banking, business banking, wealth management, and lending. Recognized as a Leader by Gartner, Omdia, IDC, and Forrester, Backbase has revolutionized how banks engage with customers in the digital age.

BAICHUAN-INTELLIGENCE.name: Baichuan Intelligence
BAICHUAN-INTELLIGENCE.tagline: Building China's most advanced large language models, from open-source foundations to breakthrough medical AI applications
BAICHUAN-INTELLIGENCE.overview: Baichuan Intelligence is one of China's leading AI startups, known as one of the four 'AI Tigers.' Founded in April 2023 by Wang Xiaochuan, the former CEO of Sogou (China's second-largest search engine), Baichuan has rapidly become the second-most valuable AI startup in China. The company develops large language models including Baichuan-7B, Baichuan-13B, and Baichuan 4, which ranks highest on SuperCLUE for Chinese language capabilities, outperforming GPT-4 Turbo and Claude 3 Opus in Chinese benchmarks. Baichuan is pioneering medical AI with Baichuan-M2Plus, called the 'Doctor's version of ChatGPT.' The core team includes AI experts from Google, Tencent, Baidu, Huawei, Microsoft, and ByteDance.

BANK-OF-LONDON.name: Bank of London
BANK-OF-LONDON.tagline: The world's first purpose-built global clearing, agency and transaction bank, modernizing payments infrastructure for the digital age
BANK-OF-LONDON.overview: Bank of London is a British clearing bank that launched in November 2021 as the United Kingdom's sixth principal clearing bank - only the second new principal clearing bank authorized in the UK in over 250 years. The bank operates an API-based payments and clearing platform and participates in UK Faster Payments and Bacs systems. Founded by Anthony Watson CBE after four years of proprietary technology development, the bank became the first pre-revenue bank to achieve unicorn status. The platform offers cloud-based core banking technology and SaaS delivery for embedded payments, enabling businesses to white-label banking infrastructure via API-first architecture.

BANMA-NETWORK-TECHNOLOGIES.name: Banma Network Technologies
BANMA-NETWORK-TECHNOLOGIES.tagline: China's leading automotive smart cockpit solutions provider, powering the intelligent vehicle ecosystem with AliOS-based technology
BANMA-NETWORK-TECHNOLOGIES.overview: Banma Network Technologies (also known as Banma Zhixing) is China's largest software-centric smart cockpit solutions provider by revenue. Founded in 2015 as a joint venture between Alibaba Group (44.72% stake) and SAIC Motor (34.34% stake), Banma develops and operates the AliOS-based connected car operating system. The company's smart cockpit solutions were installed in over 2.3 million vehicles in 2024, with a 67% compound annual growth rate over three years. Partners include Roewe, MG, Maxus, Dongfeng Citroën, Ford, and Qoros. With former DAMO Academy chief scientist Si Luo joining in October 2024, Banma is preparing for a Hong Kong IPO with Deutsche Bank, CICC, and Guotai Junan as co-sponsors.

BASETEN.name: Baseten
BASETEN.tagline: The premier AI inference platform making model deployment scalable, affordable, and reliable for production workloads
BASETEN.overview: Baseten is the premier AI inference platform powering production workloads for companies building AI applications. Founded in 2019 by Tuhin Srivastava, Philip Howes, Amir Haghighat, and Pankaj Gupta, Baseten provides infrastructure that makes model deployment scalable, affordable, and reliable. The company's revenue grew 10x year-over-year, serving major customers including Abridge, Captions, Clay, OpenEvidence, Patreon, and Writer. Baseten achieved unicorn status in 2025 with a $2.15B valuation after raising $150M in Series D. The company has strategic partnerships with AWS and Google Cloud, and recently acquired Parsed to add reinforcement learning and post-training capabilities.

BEAMERY.name: Beamery
BEAMERY.tagline: The leading AI-powered talent lifecycle management platform helping enterprises build agile workforces and make smarter talent decisions
BEAMERY.overview: Beamery is the leading AI-powered talent lifecycle management platform used by enterprise organizations including General Motors, VMware, Johnson & Johnson, Salesforce, and Amazon. BEISEN.name: Beisen Cloud Computing
BEISEN.tagline: China's leading integrated HR SaaS and talent management platform powering enterprise human capital
BEISEN.overview: Beisen Cloud Computing is China's largest HR SaaS provider, offering iTalentX, the first and only integrated cloud-based human capital management platform in China. Founded in 2002 and headquartered in Beijing, Beisen serves over 6,000 enterprises including 70% of the Fortune China 500. The iTalentX platform covers the full employee lifecycle from recruitment and evaluation to performance management, learning, and offboarding. With over 150,000 HR professionals and 20 million employees using the platform daily, Beisen has ranked first in China's HCM SaaS market for seven consecutive years according to IDC research. The company went public on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in April 2023 (stock code: 9669.HK), becoming the first Chinese HR SaaS listed company.

BERACHAIN.name: Berachain
BERACHAIN.tagline: The EVM-identical Layer 1 blockchain with Proof of Liquidity consensus aligning network security with liquidity
BERACHAIN.overview: Berachain is an EVM-identical Layer 1 blockchain built on Cosmos SDK, featuring a novel Proof of Liquidity (PoL) consensus mechanism that aligns network security with liquidity at the protocol level. The project launched its mainnet on February 6, 2025, after attracting $3.1 billion in liquidity on its pre-launch platform Boyco. Berachain uses a tri-token system: BERA for gas and transactions, BGT for governance, and HONEY as a stablecoin. Founded by pseudonymous team members known as Papa Bear, Smokey the Bera, and Dev Bear, the project evolved from the Bong Bears NFT community.

BETA-TECHNOLOGIES.tagline: Pioneering electric aviation with conventional and vertical takeoff aircraft for sustainable flight
BETA-TECHNOLOGIES.overview: Beta Technologies is a Vermont-based electric aviation company pioneering the development of all-electric aircraft and charging infrastructure. Founded in 2017 by pilot-engineer Kyle Clark, the company has developed the ALIA family of aircraft including the CX300 conventional takeoff model and A250 eVTOL. In November 2025, Beta went public on the NYSE under ticker BETA, raising over $1 billion at a $7.4 billion valuation. The CX300 received FAA special airworthiness certification in November 2024 and completed the first U.S. passenger-carrying electric flight in June 2025. With an order backlog of nearly 900 aircraft from customers including UPS, Air New Zealand, United Therapeutics, and Republic Airways, Beta is leading the electric aviation revolution. The company has also built 46+ charging sites across the country.

BETTERFLY.tagline: The first purpose-driven wellbeing and insurance platform turning healthy habits into social impact
BETTERFLY.overview: Betterfly is a purpose-driven wellbeing and insurance platform that empowers organizations and employees to improve their health while creating social impact. Founded in 2018 in Santiago, Chile by Eduardo and Cristobal Della Maggiora, Betterfly became Chile's third unicorn after raising $125M in Series C at a $1B+ valuation. The platform rewards healthy habits like walking and meditation with growing life insurance coverage and charitable donations. Betterfly is the first Latin American B Corp certified company to achieve unicorn status.

BETTERMENT.tagline: The largest independent digital investment advisor helping people make the most of their money through smarter investing
BETTERMENT.overview: Betterment is the largest independent digital investment advisor in the United States, serving over 900,000 customers with more than $55 billion in assets under management. Founded in 2008 by Jon Stein and Eli Broverman, and launched at TechCrunch Disrupt NY 2010 where it won 'Biggest New York Disruptor', Betterment pioneered the robo-advisor category. The platform offers automated investing, retirement planning, and cash management services. In 2024, Betterment acquired Goldman Sachs' Marcus Invest unit and announced the acquisition of Ellevest's automated investing business in 2025.

BETTERUP.name: BetterUp
BETTERUP.tagline: The world's largest mental health and coaching platform powering performance-ready workforces in the AI era
BETTERUP.overview: BetterUp is the world's largest mental health and coaching platform, serving 600+ organizations with 3,000+ coaches across 70 countries. Founded in 2013 by Alexi Robichaux and Eduardo Medina, BetterUp reached $4.7B valuation in 2021 and generated $215M revenue in 2024. The platform combines human coaching with AI to deliver personalized development powered by 17 million data points - the largest human behavior dataset on performance at work. Notable clients include Chipotle, Chevron, Twilio, Google, and the US Air Force ($99M contract). Prince Harry serves as Chief Impact Officer, and renowned researcher Brené Brown sits on the Scientific Board.

BEYOND-IDENTITY.tagline: The secure access platform eliminating identity-based attacks with passwordless, phishing-resistant MFA
BEYOND-IDENTITY.overview: Beyond Identity is a secure access platform that eliminates identity-based attacks with passwordless, phishing-resistant multi-factor authentication. Co-founded by Jim Clark (Netscape founder) and TJ Jermoluk, the company provides zero-trust identity architecture that assesses 70+ contextual risk factors for authentication. Beyond Identity reached unicorn status with a $1.1 billion valuation after raising $205M across three funding rounds. The platform is trusted by organizations including Snowflake, Cornell University, Charlotte Hornets, and Steve Madden.

BGL-GROUP.name: BGL Group
BGL-GROUP.tagline: The UK's leading digital distributor of insurance and financial services powering Compare the Market
BGL-GROUP.overview: BGL Group is one of the UK's largest digital distributors of insurance and financial services, best known as the owner and operator of Compare the Market, the country's leading price comparison website. Founded in 1992 by Douw Steyn as Budget Insurance Company, BGL has grown into a multi-billion pound enterprise serving millions of UK consumers. In 2022, BGL sold its insurance underwriting business to Markerstudy, refocusing on its digital comparison and distribution platforms. Under CEO Mark Bailie, who joined in September 2020, the company plans to triple its size by expanding into new financial services categories. BGL Group has raised $906 million in funding from CPP Investments and is valued at $3.2 billion.

BHARATPE.tagline: Making financial inclusion a reality for Indian merchants through UPI payments and lending
BHARATPE.overview: BharatPe is an Indian fintech company that provides digital payment solutions and financial services to small merchants and grocery stores. Founded in 2018 by Ashneer Grover and Shashvat Nakrani, BharatPe pioneered interoperable QR codes for UPI payments in India. The company serves over 10 million merchants and has raised $604M in funding with a $2.85B valuation. In April 2024, Nalin Negi was elevated to CEO. BharatPe has expanded into merchant lending, POS solutions, and recently acquired Trillion Loans in 2024.

BIGID.tagline: The leading data security, privacy, and AI data management platform protecting enterprise data at scale
BIGID.overview: BigID is a leading data security, privacy, and AI data management platform that uses advanced machine learning and identity intelligence to help enterprises protect and manage their data at petabyte scale. Founded in 2016 by security industry veterans Dimitri Sirota and Nimrod Vax, BigID became the first Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) provider to surpass $100M in revenue, earning both Unicorn and Centaur status. BIGPANDA.name: BigPanda
BIGPANDA.tagline: The AI-powered autonomous operations platform transforming IT incident management
BIGPANDA.overview: BigPanda is the pioneering leader in AI-powered IT operations (AIOps), helping enterprises transform reactive and manual incident management into intelligent, automated workflows. Founded in 2012 by former Sequoia investor Assaf Resnick, BigPanda's platform uses machine learning to correlate alerts from monitoring tools, identify root causes, and orchestrate rapid incident resolution. The platform integrates with 100+ tools including Datadog, ServiceNow, PagerDuty, and Slack. BigPanda serves hundreds of Fortune 500 enterprises, helping reduce alert noise by up to 99% and cut MTTR by 50%. The company launched Agentic IT Operations in 2025 to bring autonomous AI to the $200 billion ITOps market.

BILLIONTOONE.name: BillionToOne
BILLIONTOONE.tagline: Pioneering molecular diagnostics with single-molecule sensitivity for prenatal and oncology testing
BILLIONTOONE.overview: BillionToOne is a leading molecular diagnostics company that has pioneered single-molecule counting technology for prenatal and oncology testing. Founded by Stanford PhD Oguzhan Atay, the company developed UNITY, the first prenatal test to include single-gene and carrier screening at no additional cost, capturing approximately 15% of the U.S. prenatal testing market. Their Northstar oncology platform provides liquid biopsy tests for guiding therapy in advanced cancer patients. BillionToOne went public in November 2025 with a $273M IPO that doubled in its debut, reaching a market cap exceeding $5 billion. The company has processed over 1 million patient tests and achieved $209M in trailing twelve months revenue with 84% year-over-year growth and emerging profitability.

BILT-REWARDS.name: Bilt Rewards
BILT-REWARDS.tagline: The first loyalty program that lets you earn points on rent and build a path toward homeownership
BILT-REWARDS.overview: Bilt Rewards is a fintech company that created the first loyalty program allowing renters to earn points on rent payments. Founded in 2021 by Ankur Jain through his startup studio Kairos, Bilt has transformed how Americans think about their largest monthly expense. Members can earn points on rent and mortgage payments through ACH, debit, or credit card methods, then transfer them 1:1 to 20+ airline and hotel partners including American Airlines, United, Hyatt, and IHG. Bilt reached a $10.8 billion valuation in July 2025 after raising $250 million, becoming one of the fastest-growing fintech companies in history. Revenue grew from $113M in 2023 to $400M+ in Q1 2025, with the company targeting $1 billion by Q1 2026. Ken Chenault, former AmEx CEO, joined as Chairman.

BINANCE.name: Binance
BINANCE.tagline: The world's leading blockchain ecosystem and cryptocurrency infrastructure provider
BINANCE.overview: Binance is the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume, serving over 275 million users globally. Founded in 2017 by Changpeng Zhao (CZ), Binance has grown into a comprehensive blockchain ecosystem offering spot and derivatives trading, staking, lending, NFTs, and more. Following a $4.3 billion settlement with U.S. regulators in 2023, Richard Teng took over as CEO, bringing his regulatory background from the Monetary Authority of Singapore and Abu Dhabi Global Market. Under his leadership, Binance has prioritized compliance, becoming the most licensed crypto exchange globally with 20+ regulatory approvals. In December 2025, Binance received full ADGM authorization in Abu Dhabi for exchange, clearing, and brokerage operations, establishing its global headquarters there. The company generated $16.8 billion in revenue in 2024, up 40% from the prior year.

BINANCEUS.name: Binance.US
BINANCEUS.tagline: The regulated American cryptocurrency exchange enabling compliant digital asset trading for U.S. customers
BINANCEUS.overview: Binance.US is the American cryptocurrency exchange affiliated with global crypto giant Binance, built specifically for U.S. regulatory compliance. Founded in 2019, the platform offers trading across 160+ cryptocurrencies with low fees and staking for over 20 assets. After facing an SEC lawsuit and loss of banking access in June 2023, the exchange operated crypto-only until February 2025 when USD services were restored under interim CEO Norman Reed, a former SEC enforcement attorney. In May 2025, the SEC formally dismissed its lawsuit with prejudice, marking a major victory for the platform. Binance.US maintains a 73-person team in Palo Alto and continues rebuilding banking relationships while expanding its product suite.

BIRD.name: Bird Global
BIRD.tagline: Pioneering shared electric scooter micromobility to reduce car usage in cities (Chapter 11 bankruptcy)
BIRD.overview: Bird Global was a pioneering electric scooter sharing company founded in 2017 by former Lyft and Uber executive Travis VanderZanden. The company was a leader in the micromobility revolution, deploying shared e-scooters in cities worldwide. Bird went public via SPAC merger in late 2021 at a valuation exceeding $2 billion, but faced mounting losses and declining ridership. The company's market cap dropped from $2B to $70M within 12 months of its NYSE debut. After exiting unprofitable markets, laying off 23% of staff, and multiple CEO changes, Bird filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in December 2023. The company secured $25M in DIP financing from MidCap Financial and sought to sell its assets through a bankruptcy auction process.

BITGO.name: BitGo
BITGO.tagline: The world's leading digital asset infrastructure provider for institutional crypto custody and staking
BITGO.overview: BitGo is the world's leading digital asset infrastructure provider, offering institutional-grade custody, wallet, and staking services. Founded in 2013 by Mike Belshe (co-inventor of the HTTP/2.0 protocol), BitGo pioneered multi-signature security for Bitcoin and has grown to custody over $100 billion in assets as of 2025. The company serves as custodian for USD1, the stablecoin from World Liberty Financial that was used in MGX's $2B Binance investment. BITMAIN.name: Bitmain Technologies
BITMAIN.tagline: The world's leading designer of cryptocurrency mining ASIC chips controlling 80% of the Bitcoin mining equipment market
BITMAIN.overview: Bitmain Technologies is the world's largest designer and manufacturer of application-specific integrated circuit (ASIC) chips for cryptocurrency mining, controlling approximately 80% of the global Bitcoin mining equipment market. Founded in 2013 by Micree Zhan and Jihan Wu in Beijing, the company produces the Antminer series of mining hardware. Bitmain filed for a $1 billion Hong Kong IPO in 2018 at a $15 billion valuation, but the application lapsed in March 2019 amid Bitcoin price concerns and internal power struggles between co-founders. The company has expanded into AI chips through subsidiary Sophgo, though that entity was placed on the US Entity List in January 2025. Bitmain has made 45 investments in blockchain companies and continues to lead ASIC innovation with next-generation liquid-cooled miners developed with Hut 8.

BITPANDA.name: Bitpanda
BITPANDA.tagline: Europe's leading crypto and digital asset platform, the first to secure MiCAR licenses in Germany, Malta, and Austria
BITPANDA.overview: Bitpanda is Europe's leading cryptocurrency broker and digital asset platform, founded in 2014 by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek, and Christian Trummer in Vienna. As Austria's first unicorn with a $4.1B valuation, Bitpanda offers trading in 3,200+ digital assets including crypto, stocks, ETFs, and commodities to over 7 million users. In 2024, the company doubled revenue to €393M with EBITDA margin above 30%. Bitpanda is the first major crypto company to secure MiCAR licenses in Germany, Austria, and Malta, and received UK FCA approval, enabling reach of 500 million people across Europe. Institutional partners include LBBW, Deutsche Bank, Raiffeisen, and N26.

BITSIGHT.name: BitSight
BITSIGHT.tagline: The global leader in cyber risk management, providing security ratings and threat intelligence to help enterprises preempt cyber attacks
BITSIGHT.overview: BitSight is the global leader in cyber risk management, providing security performance monitoring, exposure analysis, and risk management for enterprises, government agencies, and educational institutions. Founded in 2011 by Stephen Boyer and Nagarjuna Venna in Boston, BitSight pioneered the security ratings market and has raised over $416M at a $2.4B valuation backed by Moody's. In 2024, BitSight acquired Cybersixgill for $115M, adding cyber threat intelligence from deep and dark web sources. The company serves Fortune 500 companies, financial institutions, and government agencies worldwide, with integrations into Splunk, ServiceNow, Microsoft Copilot, and more.

BITSO.name: Bitso
BITSO.tagline: Latin America's first crypto unicorn, powering cross-border remittances and making crypto accessible to the region
BITSO.overview: Bitso is Latin America's leading cryptocurrency platform and the region's first crypto unicorn, founded in 2014 by Daniel Vogel, Ben Peters, and Pablo González in Mexico. The company achieved over $12 billion in transaction volume in 2024 with 90% year-over-year growth. Bitso Business handles 10%+ of US-Mexico remittances, the world's largest remittance corridor, processing $6.5B in cross-border payments in 2024. Serving 8 million retail customers and 1,700 enterprise clients across Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, and Colombia, Bitso is licensed by the Gibraltar Financial Services Commission and recently integrated Bitcoin Lightning through Lightspark.

BLABLACAR.name: BlaBlaCar
BLABLACAR.tagline: The world's leading community-based long-distance travel platform, connecting drivers with empty seats to passengers heading the same way
BLABLACAR.overview: BlaBlaCar is the world's leading community-based long-distance travel platform, founded in 2006 by Frédéric Mazzella, Nicolas Brusson, and Nicolas Deroche in Paris. The platform connects drivers with empty seats to passengers heading the same way, enabling 100 million passenger journeys annually across 22 countries. BlaBlaCar achieved its first full year of profitability in 2023 and has maintained profitability for 24+ consecutive months. With €100M raised in 2024 for expansion, the company acquired Obilet, Turkey's leading bus ticketing platform distributing 45M tickets annually. India has become BlaBlaCar's largest market, accounting for one-third of global carpooling activity.

BLOCKDAEMON.name: Blockdaemon
BLOCKDAEMON.tagline: Institutional gateway to Web3 providing enterprise-grade blockchain infrastructure and staking services
BLOCKDAEMON.overview: Blockdaemon is the leading institutional blockchain infrastructure platform, securing over $110 billion in digital assets for more than 400 institutions including exchanges, custodians, and financial enterprises. Founded in 2017, the company has raised $468 million in total funding at a $3.25 billion valuation as of January 2022, with investors including Goldman Sachs, Citi Ventures, and Salesforce Ventures. Blockdaemon is the #1 staking provider for institutions with $10 billion in staked assets across 50+ blockchain protocols, delivering 99.9% uptime and managing 250,000 nodes globally. In 2025, Blockdaemon won the Best DeFi Infrastructure Platform award, launched the Earn Stack for institutional staking and DeFi, and acquired expand.network for unified DeFi API capabilities. The company is reportedly eyeing a 2026 IPO.

BLOCKSTREAM.name: Blockstream
BLOCKSTREAM.tagline: Bitcoin infrastructure leader advancing Layer 2 solutions with the Liquid Network and Lightning implementations
BLOCKSTREAM.overview: Blockstream is a leading Bitcoin infrastructure company building the foundation for financial freedom. Founded in 2014 by Dr. Adam Back (inventor of Hashcash) and other prominent Bitcoin developers, Blockstream has developed key Bitcoin technologies including the Liquid Network sidechain and Core Lightning implementation. In October 2024, the company raised $210 million led by Fulgur Ventures to accelerate Layer 2 adoption and expand its Bitcoin treasury. With over $1.8 billion in assets issued on Liquid including stablecoins and tokenized securities, and 3,844 BTC locked onchain, Blockstream is central to Bitcoin's institutional adoption. The company expanded globally in 2025 with a research center in Lugano and new Tokyo office, launched Blockstream Asset Management for institutional investors, and spun out its mining and ASIC divisions as independent companies with over $350 million in combined funding.

BLOOMREACH.name: Bloomreach
BLOOMREACH.tagline: AI-powered commerce experience platform enabling personalized discovery for 1,400+ global brands
BLOOMREACH.overview: Bloomreach is the leading AI-powered commerce experience platform serving over 1,400 global brands including Williams-Sonoma, Bosch, Puma, and Marks & Spencer. The company offers a suite of products including Discovery (AI-powered search and merchandising), Engagement (marketing automation), Content (headless CMS), and Clarity (conversational shopping). Having raised $422 million in total funding including a $175 million round led by Goldman Sachs, Bloomreach is positioned as a Gartner Magic Quadrant Leader for Commerce Search. In 2024, the company launched Loomi AI with seven premium features for personalization automation, partnered with Google Cloud and NVIDIA to enhance AI search capabilities, and announced its 2025 focus on making AI-powered personalization a revenue-driving reality for e-commerce.

BLUECORE.name: Bluecore
BLUECORE.tagline: AI-powered retail marketing platform unifying identity, behavior and product signals for personalized experiences
BLUECORE.overview: Bluecore is a leading retail marketing technology company that unifies identity, behavior, and product signals to deliver personalized experiences across email, SMS, site, and paid media. Founded in 2013, the company reached unicorn status in August 2021 with a $125 million Series E at a $1 billion valuation, bringing total funding to $225 million. Bluecore's AI platform goes beyond product recommendations to serve as a stylist, trendspotter, review summarizer, and affinity predictor, increasing purchase likelihood by 2x. In November 2024, Bluecore acquired Alby for Gen AI Shopping Assistant technology. The company's Customer Growth Benchmarks Report found retailers with highest identification rates see 53% higher repeat purchase rates. Major partnerships include Fender and DXL, with the Shopping Agent Platform enabling brands to deploy conversational AI with custom voice and brand values.

BOLTTECH.name: bolttech
BOLTTECH.tagline: Global embedded insurance platform connecting 700 partners with 230+ insurers across 30 markets
BOLTTECH.overview: bolttech is a leading global insurtech unicorn specializing in embedded insurance—providing protection products integrated into customer purchase experiences. Founded in 2020 by insurance veteran Rob Schimek, the company achieved unicorn status in 2021 and has raised over $247 million in Series C funding at a $2.1 billion valuation. bolttech connects approximately 700 distribution partners with more than 230 insurers globally across 30 markets in North America, Asia, and Europe. The platform processes approximately $65 billion in annualized quoted premiums. Major partners include Allianz, Apple, AXA, Liberty Mutual, Samsung, Lazada, and Home Credit. In December 2025, bolttech acquired Kenya's mTek in a notable East African insurtech exit. Strategic investors include Tokio Marine, MetLife, Sumitomo Corporation, Generali, and Dragon Fund.

BOOM-SUPERSONIC.name: Boom Supersonic
BOOM-SUPERSONIC.tagline: Building the world's fastest airliner to make sustainable supersonic travel a reality
BOOM-SUPERSONIC.overview: Boom Supersonic is developing Overture, the world's fastest and most sustainable commercial airliner designed to fly at Mach 1.7 with net-zero carbon emissions. Founded in 2014 by Blake Scholl, the company achieved a major milestone in January 2025 when XB-1, its demonstrator aircraft, became the first privately funded aircraft to break the sound barrier. Boom has 130 orders from American Airlines, United Airlines, and Japan Airlines. The company has raised over $700M and is valued at $3.8B, with a partnership with Northrop Grumman for military variants.

BOSTON-DYNAMICS.name: Boston Dynamics
BOSTON-DYNAMICS.tagline: Pioneering advanced mobile robots that redefine what's possible in robotics and automation
BOSTON-DYNAMICS.overview: Boston Dynamics is a world-renowned robotics company that designs and builds advanced mobile robots with remarkable mobility, agility, and autonomy. Founded in 1992 as a spin-off from MIT by Marc Raibert, the company has created some of the most sophisticated robots ever built, including the humanoid Atlas, the quadruped Spot, and the warehouse robot Stretch. In 2021, Hyundai Motor Group acquired 80% of Boston Dynamics for $880 million. In 2024, the company unveiled an all-electric version of Atlas, significantly stronger with a broader range of motion. In April 2025, Hyundai announced plans to deploy 'tens of thousands' of Boston Dynamics robots across its manufacturing facilities as part of a $21 billion US investment. Boston Dynamics also partnered with Toyota Research Institute to develop general-purpose humanoid robots using large behavior models.

BOXABL.name: Boxabl
BOXABL.tagline: Revolutionary modular housing company building foldable homes with automotive-style manufacturing efficiency
BOXABL.overview: Boxabl is a modular housing company revolutionizing construction with its foldable Casita homes that can be mass-produced on automotive-style assembly lines. The flagship 361-square-foot Casita starts at $60,000 and ships flat to unfold on-site in hours. The company announced a SPAC merger with FG Merger in 2025, valuing Boxabl at $3.5 billion, with expected Nasdaq listing under ticker BXBL. Despite over 170,000 customer reservation deposits representing $10+ billion in indicated demand, Boxabl has delivered approximately 285 Casitas while scaling its Las Vegas factory to 4,000 homes annual capacity. Key 2025 regulatory approvals include California full climate zone modular approval and Nevada residential code compliance. The company also announced the Baby Box RV unit starting at $19,999 and made a Bitcoin treasury purchase in May 2025.

BRANCH.name: Branch
BRANCH.tagline: Leading workforce payments platform powering earned wage access and embedded finance for enterprise employers
BRANCH.overview: Branch is the leading workforce payments platform enabling employers to offer fast, flexible payment options to both W-2 employees and 1099 contractors. Founded by Atif Siddiqi, Branch provides Earned Wage Access (EWA), paycards, digital banking, cashless tips, mileage reimbursement, and instant contractor payouts. In September 2025, Branch launched Branch Embedded, a solution allowing vertical SaaS platforms and gig marketplaces to integrate payments directly into their applications in weeks instead of quarters. Branch's suite includes the Branch App and Card digital banking account, White Label products, and Branch Direct. The company powers workforce payments for the nation's leading employers, enabling workers to access wages before payday and businesses to reduce turnover while unlocking new revenue streams through embedded finance.

BROWSERSTACK.tagline: The world's leading AI-powered software testing platform, running 3 million tests daily for 7 million developers across 50,000 teams
BROWSERSTACK.overview: BrowserStack is the world's leading software testing platform, powered by AI to help developers and QA teams deliver quality software at speed. Founded in 2011 by Ritesh Arora and Nakul Aggarwal from IIT Bombay, BrowserStack achieved $4B valuation in 2021 and grew to $381M revenue in 2024. The platform runs 3 million tests daily for 7 million developers across 50,000 teams including Amazon, Microsoft, and NVIDIA. Named to Forbes Cloud 100 for five consecutive years, BrowserStack has expanded through acquisitions including Bird Eats Bug ($20M, 2024), Nightwatch.js (2021), and Requestly (2025). BUGCROWD.overview: Bugcrowd is the leading crowdsourced security platform, connecting over 500,000 ethical hackers to help organizations find and fix vulnerabilities before attackers can exploit them. Bugcrowd's PTaaS business grew nearly 100% YoY, and the company added 200+ new clients in 2024. CEO Dave Gerry has transformed the company with 13 new executive appointments.

BUNQ.name: bunq
BUNQ.tagline: Europe's first profitable neobank building the first global digital banking platform
BUNQ.overview: bunq is Europe's first structurally profitable neobank, building the world's first global digital banking platform. Founded in 2012 by serial entrepreneur Ali Niknam, bunq was the first company to receive a European banking license in over 35 years. With 17 million users across Europe and more than €8 billion in deposits, bunq offers personal and business banking with innovative features like multi-currency accounts, real-time notifications, and automatic savings. The company achieved €85.3 million in profit for 2024 (65% YoY growth), marking its second consecutive profitable year. In October 2025, bunq entered the US market as an approved broker-dealer, with plans for full banking services to follow.

BYD-SEMICONDUCTOR.name: BYD Semiconductor
BYD-SEMICONDUCTOR.tagline: China's largest automotive IGBT maker powering the electric vehicle revolution
BYD-SEMICONDUCTOR.overview: BYD Semiconductor is China's largest automotive insulated gate bipolar transistor (IGBT) maker, supplying power semiconductors critical for electric vehicle powertrains. A subsidiary of BYD Company, the chip unit was spun off in 2004 and has emerged as a global competitor to Infineon and Mitsubishi Electric. The company develops IGBT modules, SiC MOSFETs, smart sensors, and optoelectronic semiconductors used in EVs, industrial applications, and renewable energy. BYD Semiconductor planned a ChiNext IPO in 2024 at a CNY 30 billion pre-money valuation, targeting up to CNY 150 billion upon listing. While the initial spinoff was scrapped in 2022 to focus on capacity expansion at the Ji'nan foundry, IPO plans have been revived with CICC as sponsor.

BYJUS.name: BYJU'S
BYJUS.tagline: India's pioneering edtech platform transforming learning through interactive digital education
BYJUS.overview: BYJU'S was once India's most valuable startup, reaching a peak valuation of $22 billion in 2022 and becoming the country's leading edtech platform with millions of students using its interactive learning app. Founded by Byju Raveendran, a former teacher, the company grew rapidly through aggressive acquisitions including Aakash Educational, WhiteHat Jr, and Great Learning. However, a combination of mounting losses exceeding $1 billion annually, aggressive expansion, regulatory scrutiny, and investor conflicts led to a dramatic collapse. In July 2024, the NCLT initiated insolvency proceedings after BCCI filed a petition over unpaid dues. The founder's net worth plummeted from $2.1 billion to zero according to Forbes. In November 2025, a US court ordered Raveendran to pay over $1.07 billion related to alleged fund diversions, marking one of the most spectacular corporate collapses in Indian startup history.

BYTON.name: BYTON
BYTON.tagline: Premium smart electric vehicle pioneer with revolutionary digital cockpit design
BYTON.overview: BYTON was a Chinese-German electric vehicle startup founded in 2017 by former BMW and Nissan executives with ambitious plans to revolutionize smart mobility. The company garnered significant attention at CES 2018 with its M-Byte concept featuring a massive 48-inch curved dashboard display. Backed by China FAW Group, CATL, Foxconn, and other major investors, BYTON raised over $1 billion and reached a valuation near $2 billion. However, repeated production delays, internal turmoil, executive departures, and financial difficulties led to suspended operations in 2020 and eventual bankruptcy in 2023. Despite partnerships with Foxconn and substantial government backing from Nanjing, the M-Byte never reached mass production, making BYTON one of the most prominent casualties of China's EV startup shakeout that saw over 400 EV companies cease operations between 2018 and 2025.
